description:
archive/zip: add SetModTime method to FileHeader

Fixes issue 2574.

messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg

http://codereview.appspot.com/5494072/diff/1/src/pkg/archive/zip/struct.go
File src/pkg/archive/zip/struct.go (right):

http://codereview.appspot.com/5494072/diff/1/src/pkg/archive/zip/struct.go#newcode99
src/pkg/archive/zip/struct.go:99: // msDosTimeToTime converts a time.Time to an MS-DOS date and time.
wrong function name in first word

http://codereview.appspot.com/5494072/diff/1/src/pkg/archive/zip/struct.go#newcode115
src/pkg/archive/zip/struct.go:115: // SetModTime sets the ModifiedTime and ModifiedDate fields to the given time.
document the loss of precision here.

http://codereview.appspot.com/5494072/diff/1/src/pkg/archive/zip/struct.go
File src/pkg/archive/zip/struct.go (right):

http://codereview.appspot.com/5494072/diff/1/src/pkg/archive/zip/struct.go#newcode99
src/pkg/archive/zip/struct.go:99: // msDosTimeToTime converts a time.Time to an MS-DOS date and time.
On 2011/12/19 03:42:57, bradfitzgoog wrote:
> wrong function name in first word

Done.

http://codereview.appspot.com/5494072/diff/1/src/pkg/archive/zip/struct.go#newcode115
src/pkg/archive/zip/struct.go:115: // SetModTime sets the ModifiedTime and ModifiedDate fields to the given time.
On 2011/12/19 03:42:57, bradfitzgoog wrote:
> document the loss of precision here.

Done.

LGTM

On Sun, Dec 18, 2011 at 7:46 PM, <adg@google.com> wrote:

>> wrong function name in first word
